alert.note: Alert for Northern Carroll; Northern Coos; Southern Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 15 at 8:41AM EST until December 18 at 12:00AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...SIGNIFICANT WINTER STORM EXPECTED LATE TONIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure across the Mid Atlantic will move north and east into southern New England tonight and on Friday...with the season`s first widespread winter storm expected to continue across the area through Saturday. ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM FRIDAY TO MIDNIGHT EST SATURDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 14 inches expected. * WHERE...Portions of south central, west central, and western Maine. Portions of northern New Hampshire. * WHEN...From 10 AM Friday to Midnight EST Saturday Night. * IMPACTS...Significant snowfall with the potential for a foot plus of snow will bring a period of impacts. Moderate snow with periods of heavy snow will create hazardous travel conditions across the region. Significant snowfall and periods of heavy snowfall rates will combine with low visibility to create very dangerous driving conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by going to newengland511.org
